TopicTitle: [1.4.3] Gameslinx's Planet Overhaul v3.4.0 [UPDATE IN PROGRESS]

Articles.Content:
2 minutes ago, Gameslinx said:

Short answer: no

Longer answer: nnoo

Proper explanation: I want Olu'um to look like a proper dwarf/failed/[...] star and this means having it emit light and heat and solar power, all of these affect gameplay.

The only other bug is with the accretion disk plugin, but i noticed it had errors before Olu'um was a star.

By your logic, is the light of this star gonna go through the planet? And the ship?

1 hour ago, Arthas_ImmortalDK said:

By your logic, is the light of this star gonna go through the planet? And the ship?

Dude stop. It's Gameslinx's mod that he made in his free time and chose to share, free of charge, with this community. It's exclusively up to him how it is made. He's already said it's not going to change. If you keep annoying him, he could choose to stop developing this or pull it off the forums (I've seen this happen over less).

1 hour ago, Arthas_ImmortalDK said:

By your logic, is the light of this star gonna go through the planet? And the ship?

No no no, I don't think you understand (language barrier)

I can fix the ambient light to make it darker, but I truly depends on your GAMMA KSP setting.

Cheers @TheRagingIrishman

11 hours ago, Gameslinx said:

No no no, I don't think you understand (language barrier)

I can fix the ambient light to make it darker, but I truly depends on your GAMMA KSP setting.

Cheers @TheRagingIrishman

I did not mean to offend anyone. I just want to help make the mod better.
Why is your Distant Object config still a separate download?  Integrate it, Gameslinx. This disturbs me.

On 29/1/2017 at 8:23 AM, Gameslinx said:

Contract to Explore Olu'um fixed

p.s im using the latest version

and i just did my first orbit

1 hour ago, KerbolExplorer said:

p.s im using the latest version

and i just did my first orbit

Welp I did my orbit, landed on all Gaia's moons and still didn't get it. Are you using 2.4 and did you update correctly (remove EVERY mod folder from this mod then reinstall?)

8 hours ago, JadeOfMaar said:

Why is your Distant Object config still a separate download?  Integrate it, Gameslinx. This disturbs me.

Shall do, I thought I included it. Perhaps not!

Cheers

6 hours ago, Gameslinx said:

Welp I did my orbit, landed on all Gaia's moons and still didn't get it. Are you using 2.4 and did you update correctly (remove EVERY mod folder from this mod then reinstall?)

must be that i did´t remove everyting before install

@KerbolExplorer The stock contract weirdness is incurable. The best you can do is send a random probe to the next place you want to go and it will distract the game from Olu'um. The contracts will focus on that new place.

You're making @Gameslinx waste his time.
@JadeOfMaar It isn't like I have anything better to do with my life at the moment

8 minutes ago, Gameslinx said:

@JadeOfMaar It isn't like I have anything better to do with my life at the moment

Ok, so I'm not crazy. You aren't getting contract issues now that you have removed the GFI? I tested your system a while back to confirm my suspicions, and without GFI and I had no issues. 

Edited July 30, 2017 by Galileo

32 minutes ago, Galileo said:

Ok, so I'm not crazy. You aren't getting contract issues now that you have removed the GFI? I tested your system a while back to confirm my suspicions, and without GFI and I had no issues. 

I didn't go that far into the career but after landing on Mun Minmus and Olei (the 3 moons of Gaia) I had no problems.

I think KerbolExplorer didn't overwrite files or updated correctly, hence why he had problems and we didn't.

I believe it is fixed

4 hours ago, Gameslinx said:

I didn't go that far into the career but after landing on Mun Minmus and Olei (the 3 moons of Gaia) I had no problems.

I think KerbolExplorer didn't overwrite files or updated correctly, hence why he had problems and we didn't.

I believe it is fixed

yup did exatly what @JadeOfMaar said
Solar panel bug wrong direction toward Olu'um is 2nd sub-star not main sun, battery went died, I fixed retract solar then extend solar back to main sun.

13 minutes ago, Wolves_Hero said:

Solar panel bug wrong direction toward Olu'um is 2nd sub-star not main sun, battery went died, I fixed retract solar then extend solar back to main sun.

Looks like a Kopernicus problemo, unless there's a way to adjust the solar power intensity in the config of the star.

I wish Kopernicus limited sunlight to the star's SOI...

(Sorry but it looks like I can't deal with this bug. Just be lucky you're getting the same amount of solar power, I guess!)

Sorry if this is answered somewhere in this thread but I extracted the game data file and noticed a lot of mods I already have installed like EVE, kopernicus, modular flight integrator, scatterer, texture replacer and module manager. So should I remove the ones I already have installed from my mods list, remove the ones I already have from this mods list or don't worry and it's all supposed to be like that and should work fine?

32 minutes ago, Spartankh said:

Sorry if this is answered somewhere in this thread but I extracted the game data file and noticed a lot of mods I already have installed like EVE, kopernicus, modular flight integrator, scatterer, texture replacer and module manager. So should I remove the ones I already have installed from my mods list, remove the ones I already have from this mods list or don't worry and it's all supposed to be like that and should work fine?

Remove what's already there or things will mess up!

Hey @Gameslinx, any chance of this becoming Linux compatible in the near future?  Last thing I want to do is hassle you, so I won't post about this again, but just know that some of us Linux folk would love to get out into your system.  I gave it a shot messing about with configs, and I can't figure it out.  Here's a snippet from ksp.log that I think is the problem:

In game behavior is the same: when I start a new game it hangs on the black screen with the loading spinny planets icon.

4 hours ago, Jetski said:

Hey @Gameslinx, any chance of this becoming Linux compatible in the near future?  Last thing I want to do is hassle you, so I won't post about this again, but just know that some of us Linux folk would love to get out into your system.  I gave it a shot messing about with configs, and I can't figure it out.  Here's a snippet from ksp.log that I think is the problem:

I'm still working on it, sorry:(

The log is useful though, Thanks!

Hi, I really like your MOD, but there is an issue I don't know how to fix it and I'm not sure did this happened on many people? When I install the MOD, my FPS gets drop so hard, in the base my fps only have 20FPS, and some times it drops to 10 or even lower. Do you have any suggestion to solve the problem? My computer is I7 6700K, NVIDIA GTX1080Ti, 32g DDR4. Please let me know. Thank you
